ScopeItems.Description: We are proposing an initial set of Grasshopper Components to expose the AutoCAD functionality from inside Grasshopper.  These components will initially be a limited set of parameters and methods, but could be expanded in the future scope document if users request specific functions.
ScopeItems.Name: Grasshopper Component Library

ScopeItems.AcceptanceCriteria: This scope item will be deem complete when all its child Backlog Items have been accepted.
ScopeItems.Name: Create the Application Infrastructure

ScopeItems.Description:
We follow Clean Architecture principles. The software architecture shall be structured using five domain layers:
Core: The core layer provides core infrastructure for the entire codebase, including interfaces, and application functionality.
Infrastructure: The infrastructure layer containing projects such as solvers, geometry wrapper libraries, and compatibility interop projects.
Applications: The application layer is where all GUI applications shall.
UI: The UI layer contains GUI infrastructure. 
Plugin: Used for interop with external applications, e.g. AutoCAD.
ScopeItems.Name: Create the projects using the Bimorph Project Templates.

ScopeItems.Name: Net Version Support
Set Up the Solution with builds for .NET4.8 and NET8.

ScopeItems.Description: Create the installer project. The initial scope will incorporate support for Autodesk AutoCAD Versions 2022-2026 and Rhino Versions 7-8 and Grasshopper 1. Rhino 9 and Grasshopper 2 support can be discussed in later change Orders
ScopeItems.Name: Create the Installer project

ScopeItems.Description:
Conversions are to be handled via a Converter Singleton class. This singleton is initialized when the Rhino Core is created and can be used to convert any supported geometry types.

A singleton GeometryConverter provides centralized control with consistent conversion logic, error handling, and validation across the application, while offering superior testability through easy mocking compared to static extension methods. It enables runtime flexibility to adapt behavior based on the version of the application running. The trade-off is a less discoverable API (converter.ToRhinoType(geometry)) versus natural extension syntax (geometry.ToRhinoType()), but the architectural benefits outweigh this convenience in complex applications.

 If the extension methods are required, then they can also be easily added in future change orders and will call the singleton Converter in their methods.
ScopeItems.AcceptanceCriteria: This scope item will be deem complete when all its child Backlog Items have been accepted.
ScopeItems.Name: Geometry Conversion

ScopeItems.Description: Unit Conversion will be handled by a UnitCoversionManager, which will take the Units from the open instance of AutoCAD and Rhino, and it is responsible for converting between them. The Rhino Units become the Internal Units, and all Rhino Geometry and internal infrastructure will use these units within the plugin; the AutoCAD units are the Document Units and only the CAD Geometry will use them. The UnitCoversionManager is created when the Rhino.Core is started and will have listeners for if either of the application's units are changed.
ScopeItems.AcceptanceCriteria: This scope item will be deem complete when all its child Backlog Items have been accepted.
ScopeItems.Name: Unit Support

ScopeItems.Description: Create the UnitCoversionManager and initialize with when Rhino.Core is started
ScopeItems.Name: UnitCoversionManager

ScopeItems.Description: Shared infrastructure for all Grasshopper Components
ScopeItems.AcceptanceCriteria: This scope item will be deem complete when all its child Backlog Items have been accepted.
ScopeItems.Name: Infrastructure

ScopeItems.Description:
Each component opens a transaction, makes the changes it needs to, and then commits the transaction on each solution completion.  The benefits of this it is simple to implement, and each component only needs to be responsible for its own transaction. However, this may become inefficient on complex Grasshopper definitions.

Infrastructure should be added to enable support this.
ScopeItems.Name: Transactions

ScopeOrders.Name: Rhino.Inside.Autocad
ScopeOrders.Description: The Initial Phase of the development, The goal of the phase is to get an initial release of the plugin available for the  community so they can help shape its future development with the Feature Requests which they require.
